result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Echols was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision,  by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes: No violations of criminal law rising to the leve of probable cause.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor; he must provide a  DNA sample/biolgical specimen for analysis.  If this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated you may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet conditions under the Statute; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian K Echols

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. jbs
on count 1.  Petitioner's address:  Brian Echols  #631604, Oakhill Correctional Institution, PO Box 938, Oregon, WI  53575.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (21 pages) commencing JUNE 24, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Brian K Echols in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Brian K Echols in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated you may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet conditions under the statute and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 6 years with 38 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 3 years  and 6 months -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years and 6 months; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Brian K Echols in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Brian K Echols in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court by 4:00 p.m. on 6-22-15.  

Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.  Jury trial is cancelled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions and Instructions received and filed./ds
State's Motion in Limine received and filed./ds

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Brian K Echols not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense does not have discovery.   Any motions are to be filed within the next five days.   Pretrial Scheduling Order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Speedy trial demand. (DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND, AFTER DATE HAD BEEN PREVIOUSLY SELECTED WITH CO-COUNSEL'S.)

Defendant Brian K Echols in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Brian K Echols in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of "May 17, 2015" in Count 1 on page 1.  Stipulation to the previous conviction of the Defendant in Cook County, IL case #01CR1202801 is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Kent Corbett-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brian K Echols in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Defendant Brian K Echols in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
